Using formulae and substitution

In the study of engineering, physical quantities can be related to each other using a formula. The formula will contain variables and constants which represent the physical quantities. To evaluate a formula we must substitute numbersin place of the variables.

For example, Ohmâ€™s law provides a formula for relating the voltage, \(v\), across a resistor with resistance value, \(R\), to the current through it, \(i\). The formula states \[\begin{aligned} v &= iR\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\end{aligned}\]We can use this formula to calculate \(v\) if we know values for \(i\) and \(R\). For example, if \(i=13\) \(\textrm{A}\), and \(R=5\,\Omega\), then \[\begin{aligned} v &= iR\\ &= (13)(5)\\ &= 65\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\end{aligned}\]The voltage is 65 \(\textrm{V}\).

Note that it is important to pay attention to the units of any physical quantities involved. Unless a consistent set of units is used a formula is not valid.

Example

The kinetic energy, \(K\), of an object of mass \(M\) moving with speed \(v\) can be calculated from the formula, \(K=\dfrac{1}{2}Mv^2\). Calculate the kinetic energy of an object of mass 5 \(\textrm{kg}\) moving with a speed of 2 \(\textrm{ms}^{-1}\).

Solution

In this example M = 5 and v = 2. Substituting these values into the formula we find\[\begin{aligned} v &={1\over 2}Mv^2\\ &= {1\over 2}(5)(2^2)\\ &= 10 \qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\end{aligned}\]

Example

The volume, \(V\), of a circular cylinder is equal to its cross-sectional area, \(A\), times its length, \(h\). Find the volume of a cylinder having diameter 0.1 \(\textrm{m}\) and length 0.3 \(\textrm{m}\).

Solution

We can use the result of the previous Task to obtain the cross-sectional area \(A=\dfrac{\pi d^2}{4}\). Then\[\begin{aligned} V &= Ah\\ &= \dfrac{\pi d^2}{4}\times0.3\\ &= 0.0024 \qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\end{aligned}\]
